FederatedCredential.summary: NOTE Experimental The FederatedCredential interface of the Credential Management API provides information about credentials from a federated identity provider. A federated identity provider is an entity that a website trusts to correctly authenticate a user, and that provides an API for that purpose. OpenID Connect is an example of a federated identity provider framework.

blockquote.para: The Federated Credential Management API (FedCM) provides a more complete solution for handling identity federation in the browser, and uses the type.

remarks.para: In browsers that support it, an instance of this interface may be passed in the credential member of the init object for global .

FederatedCredentialFederatedCredential.summary: NOTE Experimental The FederatedCredential() constructor creates a new object. In supporting browsers, an instance of this class may be passed the credential received from the init object for global .

FederatedCredentialProvider.summary:
NOTE Experimental The provider property of the
interface returns a string
containing a credential's federated identity provider.
FederatedCredentialProvider.value: A string containing a credential's federated identity provider.

FederatedCredentialProtocol.summary:
NOTE Experimental The protocol property of the
interface returns a read-only
string containing a credential's federated identity protocol. If this
property is null, the protocol may be inferred from the
property.
FederatedCredentialProtocol.value:
A string containing a credential's federated identity protocol (e.g.
openidconnect).
